data.title: Level 7 by Mordecai Roshwald
data.meta_description: Level 7 by Roshwald, Mordecai (1921-) and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.co.uk.
data.text:
Condition: Good. SHIPS FROM USA. Used books have different signs of use and do not include supplemental materials such as CDs, Dvds, Access Codes, charts or any other extra material. All used books might have various degrees of writing, highliting and wear and tear and possibly be an ex-library with the usual stickers and stamps. Dust Jackets are not guaranteed and when still present, they will have various degrees of tear and damage. All images are Stock Photos, not of the actual item. book.

Softcover. Condition: Good. 1. Level 7 is the diary of Officer X-127, who is assigned to stand guard at the "Push Buttons," a machine devised to activate the atomic destruction of the enemy, in the country's deepest bomb shelter. Four thousand feet underground, Level 7 has been built to withstand the most devastating attack and to be self-sufficient for five hundred years. Selected according to a psychological profile that assures their willingness to destroy all life on Earth, those who are sent down may never return. Originally published in 1959, and with over 400,000 copies sold, this powerful dystopian novel remains a horrific vision of where the nuclear arms race may lead and is an affirmation of human life and love. Level 7 merits comparison to Huxley's A Brave New World and Orwell's 1984 and should be considered a must-read by all science fiction fans.

Condition: Fair. Acceptable condition. Acceptable dust jacket. Book Club edition. (science fiction, sci-fi, dystopia) A readable, intact copy that may have noticeable tears and wear to the spine. All pages of text are present, but they may include extensive notes and highlighting or be heavily stained. Includes reading copy only books. Bundled media such as CDs, DVDs, floppy disks or access codes may not be included.

Soft cover. Condition: Fine. Gene Szafran (Armageddon) (illustrator). 1st Edition. Excellent two book lot with both books being the first paperback edition/printings and each in Fine condition (sharp collectible): Level 7 (1961 Signet D1956), and; Armageddon (1976 Signet W7194). This pair of novels are among the best at exploring the world of nuclear tensions around the mid-Twentieth Century. Level 7 is the 'underground' cult classic of "pushing the button" while Armageddon uses satire (power and sex) in a darkly humorous vein!.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Good. Book Club Edition. McGraw Hill, New York, 1959, Hardcover Book Club edition. Book is Very Good in a Good dust jacket - jacket has a 4 inch closed tear at the spine base; sticker removal stain at spine base & other wear/closed tears at top/bottom of spine; staining on the rear - comes in a removable, archival, mylar sleeve.

Mass Market Paperback. Condition: Good. No Jacket. Signet copyright 1959, Original price in corner with 451-05956 in corner. numberline (10-18) . Book Condition: Good. Illustrated covers, slight shelf wear on edges. Light crease along left side and bottom conrer of cover. No crease on spine. bright letters. The white of cover yellowed, some light soiling but still 1dark letters and illustration. Edges of pages tinted yellow, bright beige pages tightly bound. Prev. owner's name on back of cover and faded initials on cover. Clean with no writing or marks on pages. A nice reading copy. Synopsis: " A horritying, prophetic document of the future- the diary of a man living 4000 ft. undergroung in a society hell-bent on atomic self-destruction".

Mass Market Paperback. Condition: Used Good. Text is in English. Size - H: 7', W: 4.25', D: .5' This item is Used and is listed as being in Good condition. Signet D1956. First Printing. Edge wear and rubbed cover. Spine is intact and uncreased. Pages clean. FF00000003647 Firefly sells new and used books through our store front. We try to add a detailed description to as many titles as possible. If you have questions regarding this title, please contact us. Photos available on request.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good+. Dust Jacket Condition: Good+. Book Club Edition. We consider each and every book we sell to be a treasure. That's why we provide accurate individualized condition descriptions; ship in sturdy protective packaging; and offer excellent customer service.; Black cover is rubbed and bumped at corners and spine caps but clean and in very good+ condition. Boards and spine are straight. Binding is tight. Pages are clean and pristine. Book has never been cracked open. Dust jacket is toned with multiple chips and tears and a barely visible cup ring but overall good+. DJ protected by a brand new, clear, acid-free mylar cover. We add mylar covers to all books with DJs to preserve the DJs and add luster to magnify their beauty. (If pictured, shown without the mylar cover for an accurate representation of dust jacket. ); 8.0 X 5.7 X 1.1 inches; 183 pages.
